data.title: Fitting the Form
data.solution:
s = input()
f = input()

processed = []

num = 0
for c in f:
    if c == 'X':
        processed.append(f's[{num}].upper()')
        num += 1
    elif c == 'x':
        processed.append(f's[{num}].lower()')
        num += 1
    else:
        processed.append(f"{c.__repr__()}")

print(eval('+'.join(processed)))
data.statement:
Given a string [[s]] and a form [[f]], fit the string to the form. For example, you might have form {{xXxx}} and string {{duck}}. The output would be {{dUck}}. 

The form may also have periods or other symbols or letters in them - your program should output these characters as well.  Example: If the form was {{Xxx, Xx}} and the input was {{samJR}} then the expected output would be {{Sam, Jr}} (note the space after the commas!) Another example would be the form {{RE: xxXxxx}} with string {{banana}}, which should have the output {{RE: baNana}}.

Essentially, the form will be {{x}}'s and {{X}}'s, which each letter in the input should be changed to match the case of, but the characters in between should also be outputted.

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
DUCKYQUAXXApFkvAjguzAljfGABja
XxXxx Libitina has not yet XxxxxXx.exe from the termination of XXXXXX and is not expected to do so in the near future. Xx_xXxx.exe to xdminister these tests will only X-elerate the deterioration of Libitina's health.
testCases.testOut: DuCky Libitina has not yet QuaxxAp.efe from the termination of KVAJGU and is not ezpected to do so in the near future. Al_jFga.ebe to jdminister these tests will only A-elerate the deterioration of Libitina's health.

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
DUCKYSAyoRIpFkvAjguzAljfGABjaGa
XxXXX Libitina has not yet XxXxxXx.XXX from the termination of XXXXXX and is not expected to do so in the near future. Xx_xXxx.exe to xdminister these tests will only X-elerate the deterioration of Libitina's health.
testCases.testOut: DuCKY Libitina has not yet SaYorIp.FKV from the termination of AJGUZA and is not elpected to do so in the near future. Jf_gAbj.eae to gdminister these tests will only A-elerate the deterioration of Libitina's health.

data.constraints:
[[s]] contains only letters.
Length of [[f]] < 250
The number of {{x}}'s and {{X}}'s always equals the length of [[s]].
data.stubGenerator:
read s:string(100)
read f:string(300)
write answer

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string s and a form f, fit the string to the form. For example, you might have form xXxx and string duck. The output would be dUck.

The form may also have periods or other symbols or letters in them - your program should output these characters as well. Example: If the form was Xxx, Xx and the input was samJR then the expected output would be Sam, Jr (note the space after the commas!) Another example would be the form RE: xxXxxx with string banana, which should have the output RE: baNana.

Essentially, the form will be x's and X's, which each letter in the input should be changed to match the case of, but the characters in between should also be outputted.
Input
Line 1: The string s.
Line 2: The form f.
Output
The formatted string.
Constraints
s contains only letters.
Length of f < 250
The number of x's and X's always equals the length of s.
Example
Input
sAmMyJr
Xxxxx, Xx.
Output
Sammy, Jr.
